title: Symbolic Continuity Framework for High-Friction Retail Environments
purpose: This framework adapts the Recursive Coexistence Protocol (RCP — a system that allows AI to reflect on previous decisions, rather than just respond), a lightweight structure that guides AI systems to simulate human-like reflection and decision continuity, to support fast-paced, high-friction environments.
key_challenges: Difficulty maintaining consistent onboarding outcomes without shared experiential memory
Difficulty training new hires in intangible experience (emotional labor, soft skills)
Fractured team memory and lack of shared context

symbolic_memory.description: Implement symbolic memory summaries instead of raw logs, including contextual memory trimming.

reflective_training.description: Uses recursive question loops to promote employee reflection on behavior and emotional impact.
benefits: Improves customer satisfaction through mindful presence

continuity_agent.description: A symbolic AI agent monitoring CRM/POS for context loss, alerting next shift or management.

employee_state_mapping.description: Strictly opt-in, anonymized symbolic summaries for employee reflection, with misuse considered an ethical breach.
benefits: Anonymized trend reporting only if explicitly enabled

bias_visibility_layer.description: Introduces bias tagging for recommendations. Misuse for profiling is an ethical violation.

hardware_and_runtime: Local or cloud LLMs (Qwen, LLaMA, Mistral)
Mobile, kiosk, or terminal UI options

ethics_alignment.description: Precision is not justice. Performance is not fairness. Symbolic systems promote fairness, adaptability, and ethical reflection for both employees and managers.

multi_industry_examples.Hospitality: Anchor confidence with popular room features during check-in hesitation.
multi_industry_examples.Call Center: Shift to empathetic scripting if voice tone flattens post-verification.
multi_industry_examples.Retail: Prompt reflective dialogue during prolonged product comparison.
multi_industry_examples.Inside Sales: Use flexible value framing instead of discount pressure during pricing hesitation.
multi_industry_examples.Caution: Avoid pushy tactics. Symbolic systems are meant for ethical engagement, not manipulation.

data_governance.employee_reflection_data: Never shared with HR or used in performance reviews without explicit opt-in
data_governance.memory_decay: Symbolic entries self-trim over time unless reinforced
data_governance.bias_layer_logs: Used only for pattern improvement, not individual profiling. Deliberate misuse of this layer for targeting or penalizing individuals is considered an ethical violation.

symbolic_memory_types.Recovery Patterns: e.g., 'When overwhelmed, shift to paced dialogue'

symbolic_memory_types.Conversion Patterns: e.g., 'Customer asked about return policy before buying — reassure then close'

symbolic_memory_types.Context Traps: e.g., 'Follow-up failed due to shift change, mark for continuity agent'

symbolic_memory_types.Emotional Anchors: e.g., 'Customer relaxed after humor; use when tension rises'

status: Next steps: UI prototype, memory engine deployment, training corpus design

glossary.Symbolic Memory: Condensed, human-readable behavior summaries used for training.
glossary.Reflective Training: Feedback system using questions to build emotional insight.
glossary.Bias Visibility Layer: Tracks logic behind decisions, exposing helpful and harmful bias.
glossary.Employee State Mapping: Voluntary emotional state tagging with anonymity and ethical safeguards.
glossary.Continuity Agent: Detects interaction gaps in systems and facilitates smoother handoff.
